wikipedia_page.main: Robert Camden Cope (1771 – 5 December 1818 or 1819) was a British politician from Loughgall, County Armagh in Ireland. He sat in the First Parliament of the United Kingdom.

response: :Archibald Acheson and Robert Camden Cope were co-opted as non-partisans in 1801.

response: He was the son of Robert Cope and the uncle of Robert Camden Cope.
* Robert Camden Cope (died 1818), Member of Parliament for Armagh

Cope was married twice: firstly in 1707 to Lettice, daughter of Arthur Brownlow, and secondly in 1711 to Elizabeth, daughter of Sir William Fownes. By his second wife he had several children, including Anthony, Dean of Armagh, and Arthur, whose son Robert Camden Cope was also MP for Armagh.E. M. Johnston-Liik, History of the Irish Parliament 1692–1800 (Ulster Historical Foundation, 2002) vol. III, pp. 505-506.
